text: <extra_id_0> Cyclin A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription is cell cycle regulated and induced by cell proliferative signals .

text: To understand the mechanisms underlined in this regulation in normal human cells , we have analysed in vivo protein - DNA interactions at the <extra_id_0> Cyclin A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus in primary T lymphocytes .

Stimulation of purified T lymphocytes by a combination of monoclonal antibodies directed at <extra_id_0> CD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> adhesion molecules gives rise to a long lasting proliferation in the absence of accessory cells .

<extra_id_0> Cyclin A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was observed after 4 days of costimulation with anti <extra_id_0> CD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> whereas stimulation by anti <extra_id_0> CD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or anti <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone was not effective .
In vivo genomic DMS footprinting revealed upstream of the major transcription initiation sites , the presence of at least three protein binding sites , two of which were constitutively occupied .
They bind in vitro respectively <extra_id_0> ATF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and NF-Y proteins .
The third site was occupied in quiescent cells or in cells stimulated by anti <extra_id_0> CD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or anti <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone .

The mitogenic combination of anti <extra_id_0> CD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + anti <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> released the footprint as cells were committed to proliferation .

Consistent with theses results , nuclear extracts prepared from quiescent cells formed a specific complex with this element , whereas extracts prepared from cells treated with anti <extra_id_0> CD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + anti <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> failed to do so after cells entered a proliferative state .
